title: [K-12] Digital Science Education Design Workshop: Smartphone-Based Collaborative Projects

context.prior_knowledge: Basic science knowledge and fundamental smartphone usage skills
context.additional_context: A course aiming to strengthen digital science education design capabilities in smartphone-centric restricted technology environments. Cultivates collaborative e-learning tool competencies applicable to authentic science education scenarios

learning_goals: Using smartphone-based collaboration tools (Google Docs, Padlet, etc.), learners design one digital science education content piece (3-minute video or infographic) and complete a production process meeting ≥3 of 5 peer evaluation rubric criteria
Cultivation of the ability to establish project improvement plans through peer feedback systems.

Within one week, learners develop a prototype web platform for science experiment simulations executable in limited technical environments (low-spec PCs, unstable internet), meeting the following standards: 1) implementation of ≥3 basic science experiments (density, electric circuits, photosynthesis), 2) passing usability tests by ≥5 peer evaluators, 3) inclusion of offline mode support

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
